DOC.brief_title: Comparison AC PC Lenses After Vitreous Loss During ECCE
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Hypothesis : There difference failure rate patient receive anterior chamber posterior chamber intraocular lens follow vitreous loss extracapsular cataract extraction ( ECCE ) . Secondary Hypothesis : None Intervention : 1 ) Anterior chamber intraocular lens , 2 ) Posterior chamber intraocular lens . Primary Outcome : Failure define best correct visual acuity le 20/40 one year follow ECCE . Study Abstract : Extracapsular cataract surgery posterior chamber intraocular lens implantation one common successful surgical procedure . In United States alone approximately 1.4 million cataract extraction perform 1990 . Of overwhelming majority well . However , principal complication , vitreous loss , occur 5 % case . It often sight-limiting . Placement intraocular lens presence vitreous loss controversial . The standard approach follow anterior vitrectomy usually involve placement anterior chamber intraocular lens ( AC IOL ) . However , suggest implantation posterior chamber intraocular lens ( PC IOL ) many patient possible , preferable . In study , eligible patient VA patient vitreous loss attempt ECCE . At occurrence vitreous loss , patient randomly assign AC IOL PC IOL . Patient recruitment terminate early 438 patient enrol 15 center . Patients follow completion least one-year follow-up . An ? Index Group ? 500 patient without vitreous loss also follow accord study protocol . These patient compare PC AC IOL group respect outcome baseline characteristic order ass effect vitreous loss complication rate . Results : More PC IOL patient ( 91 % ) achieve visual acuity 20/40 well one year AC IOL patient ( 79 % ) . A highly significant difference ( p=0.003 ) . There significant difference two group patient ' rating vison adverse event . Over 84 % PC IOL patient 77 % AC IOL patient rat vision good well one year oppose 7 % give rating prior surgery . For least one rating period first year , 13.2 % combine study patient cystoid macular edema , 8.5 % posterior capsule opacification , 5.7 % glaucoma , 3.7 % retinal detachment . Conclusion : In presence sufficient capsular support , PC IOL implant vitreous presentation ECCE .
